intro: Phlomis maeotica, commonly known as the Crimean phlomis, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its tall, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
